name: Andean Guan
behavior: Social, often in small groups; arboreal
description: A medium-sized, turkey-like bird with dark plumage, a red throat wattle, and a long tail. It has a distinctive whistling call and is often seen perched in trees. The Andean Guan plays a key role in seed dispersal in its ecosystem.

name: Band-tailed Guan
behavior: Shy, often in pairs or small flocks
description: A large guan with a banded tail, dark plumage, and a pale-tipped tail. It has a loud, honking call and is primarily arboreal. The species is threatened by habitat loss.

name: Barred Tinamou
description: A small, cryptically colored tinamou with barred plumage, blending into the forest floor. It has a soft, whistling call and is rarely seen due to its elusive nature.

name: Bartlett's Tinamou
behavior: Solitary, walks quietly on forest floor
description: A small, reddish-brown tinamou with a short tail and subtle barring. It is highly secretive and prefers swampy habitats. Its call is a low-pitched whistle.

name: Baudo Guan
description: A large, dark guan with a distinctive white eye-ring and red throat patch. It is endemic to a small region and highly threatened by deforestation.

name: Bearded Guan
description: A striking guan with a "beard" of elongated feathers on its throat. It has a loud, repetitive call and is often seen in family groups.

name: Berlepsch's Tinamou
description: A small, dark tinamou with a short bill and reddish legs. It is poorly studied due to its secretive habits and dense habitat preferences.

name: Biak Scrubfowl
description: A megapode with dark plumage and strong legs for digging. It buries eggs in warm sand or compost heaps for incubation. Endemic to Biak, it is vulnerable to habitat destruction.

name: Black-capped Tinamou
description: A small tinamou with a black cap and barred underparts. It prefers dry habitats and has a soft, mournful call.

name: Black-fronted Piping Guan
description: A striking guan with black and white plumage, a blue face, and a loud piping call. It is critically endangered due to hunting and deforestation.

name: Brown Tinamou
description: A plain brown tinamou with a faintly barred chest. It is widespread but rarely seen due to its shy nature and camouflage.

name: Cauca Guan
description: A rare guan with dark plumage and a bare red throat patch. It is endemic to a small region and highly threatened by deforestation.

name: Chaco Chachalaca
description: A noisy, gregarious bird with a grayish body and a distinctive raucous call. Often seen in family groups in dry woodlands.

name: Chestnut-headed Chachalaca
description: A chachalaca with a chestnut head and grayish body. It has a loud, repetitive call and is often seen in small flocks.

name: Chilean Tinamou
description: A small, quail-like tinamou with streaked plumage. It prefers open habitats and has a whistling call.

name: Choco Tinamou
description: A rare tinamou with dark plumage and a short tail. It is endemic to the Choc√≥ and threatened by deforestation.

name: Cinereous Tinamou
description: A plain grayish tinamou with a faintly barred chest. It is common but rarely seen due to its secretive habits.

name: Common Ostrich
description: The world's largest bird, flightless, with long legs and neck. Males are black-and-white, females brown. Known for speed (70 km/h) and large eggs.

name: Curve-billed Tinamou
description: A highland tinamou with a curved bill and streaked plumage. It prefers grassy slopes and has a whistling call.

name: Dusky-legged Guan
description: A dark guan with reddish legs and a loud, honking call. Often seen in small flocks in subtropical forests.

name: Dwarf Tinamou
description: The smallest tinamou, with buff-colored plumage and a short tail. It is endangered due to grassland destruction.

name: Elegant Crested Tinamou
description: A distinctive tinamou with a crest and barred plumage. It prefers arid habitats and has a whistling call.

name: Great Spotted Kiwi
description: A large, nocturnal kiwi with coarse, grayish-brown feathers and a long bill. It is endangered due to predation.

name: Great Tinamou
description: A large, ground-dwelling tinamou with a deep, resonant call. It plays a key role in seed dispersal in tropical forests.

name: Grey-headed Chachalaca
description: A noisy bird with a gray head and brown body. Often seen in family groups, feeding on fruits in trees.

name: Highland Tinamou
description: A high-altitude tinamou with dark plumage and a short tail. It has a soft, whistling call.

name: Hooded Tinamou
description: A dark tinamou with a black cap and barred underparts. It prefers dense cloud forests and is rarely observed.

name: Huayco Tinamou
description: A large tinamou with spotted plumage and a loud, whistling call. It prefers arid habitats.

name: Lesser Nothura
description: A tiny, quail-like tinamou with streaked plumage. It is endangered due to habitat loss.

name: Lesser Rhea
description: A smaller relative of the Greater Rhea, with grayish plumage and long legs. It lives in Patagonian steppes.

name: Little Spotted Kiwi
description: The smallest kiwi, with soft, spotted feathers. It was nearly extinct but has been reintroduced to predator-free islands.

name: Malleefowl
description: A large megapode with intricate mound-building behavior. It regulates egg temperature using compost heaps.

name: Micronesian Megapode
description: A dark, chicken-like bird that uses geothermal heat or sun-warmed sand to incubate eggs. Endangered due to habitat loss.

name: New Guinea Scrubfowl
description: A megapode with strong legs for digging. It buries eggs in large mounds of decaying vegetation.

name: Ornate Tinamou
description: A highland tinamou with beautifully patterned plumage. It prefers open grassy areas.

name: Puna Tinamou
description: A large, high-altitude tinamou with grayish plumage and a loud call. It is adapted to cold climates.

name: Quebracho Crested Tinamou
description: A crested tinamou with barred plumage. It prefers arid habitats and has a whistling call.

name: Red-billed Brushturkey
description: A large megapode with a red bill and dark plumage. It builds massive incubation mounds for its eggs.

name: Southern Brown Kiwi
description: A brown kiwi with shaggy feathers and a long bill. It is threatened by introduced predators.

name: Spix's Guan
description: A dark guan with a red throat patch. It is common in the Amazon but declining due to hunting.

name: Sula Megapode
description: A small megapode endemic to the Sula Islands. It relies on geothermal heat for egg incubation.

name: Tepui Tinamou
description: A small tinamou restricted to remote tepui plateaus. It is poorly known due to its isolated habitat.

name: Thicket Tinamou
description: A small, cinnamon-colored tinamou with a whistling call. It prefers dense undergrowth.

name: Tongan Megapode
description: One of the rarest megapodes, surviving only on Niuafo'ou Island. It uses volcanic heat for incubation.

name: Trinidad Piping Guan
description: A striking blue-faced guan with a loud piping call. It is on the brink of extinction due to hunting.

name: Undulated Tinamou
description: A medium-sized tinamou with wavy barring on its plumage. It has a soft, whistling call.

name: Vanuatu Megapode
description: A dark megapode that buries eggs in geothermal areas. It is endemic to Vanuatu and threatened by habitat loss.

name: Wattled Brushturkey
description: A large megapode with wattles and a helmet-like casque. It builds massive incubation mounds.

name: White-bellied Nothura
description: A tiny tinamou with a white belly and streaked back. It prefers open, arid habitats.

name: White-winged Guan
description: A large guan with white wing patches. It was thought extinct until rediscovered in 1977. Fewer than 200 remain.
